article_title: ObamaCare: They Have Themselves to Blame
article_text:
In response to your Nov. 23 editorial “ UnitedHealth’s ObamaCare Reckoning” regarding UnitedHealth’s concerns about the ObamaCare risk pool lacking the younger, healthier consumers who are supposed to buy the plans to subsidize the rest of their participants:

The reason many younger, healthier consumers are not purchasing insurance is that a significant portion of that market was eliminated by allowing adults aged 21-26 to be covered under their parents’ plans. Historically, consumers aged 21-26 had been notorious for...

article_summary:
Historically, consumers aged 21-26 had been notorious for...
In response to your Nov. 23 editorial “ UnitedHealth’s ObamaCare Reckoning” regarding UnitedHealth’s concerns about the ObamaCare risk pool lacking the younger, healthier consumers who are supposed to buy the plans to subsidize the rest of their participants:The reason many younger, healthier consumers are not purchasing insurance is that a significant portion of that market was eliminated by allowing adults aged 21-26 to be covered under their parents’ plans.
